value: all right try this on for size
why does it hurt for so long even after
you've figured it all out and you know
they treated you badly and you know
they're disordered they're disordered
people even though you have every right
to be mad at them and maybe you are mad
at them so why then why would it keep
hurting you know for years
after you've gotten no contact how do
you get over that sadness the sadness it
cripples you well my theory is that the
pain the hurt the sadness
is like a safety blanket a teddy bear
like a memory from childhood it's the
only thing you have left of your family
like a locket with a piece a little torn
picture of that person
except it isn't a locket and you can't
put it down and you can't forget about
it put in a drawer it's part of you it's
it's it's it's eating a hole in your in
your heart and it's preventing you from
living the full life you deserve
I don't think that I don't think that
we're broken when we hurt for years and
years over the same thing I think what's
happening is we're not giving ourselves
permission to let them go whether it's
out of some notion that someday we'll
put the relationship back together and
so as long as we have this little thread
of pain that goes back to them that's
like a bridge we're going to get there
we have something to start from when we
put the relationship back together I
think that's
it's foolish but until you recognize it
you don't know you're being foolish you
know all you know is it hurts
when I was no contact on my own terms
not all the times my mother stopped
talking to me gave me the silent
treatment but this time when I said the
words I'm not talking to you anymore
this time I let myself feel like she
died and it was still painful but I got
to go through all the stages of grief I
didn't get stuck at sadness I got to
acceptance and now on the occasions that
she has sent a flying monkey they appear
to me like ghosts and I have the
appropriate reaction which would be this
communication is unnatural and I should
be on my alert and I should get rid of
it as soon as possible it's not it's not
real even it's a it's a mirage my
reality has changed and it doesn't
include them at all
yeah it's possible that you're hurting
and you're sad because you're waiting
for these people to come back from the
dead
you know because really really if you
have identified that this person is a
narcissist
if you've already tried then there is
not a relationship that you're waiting
to repair and you have to get there
mentally listen if you lost someone to a
to duck to death if they died it would
not be healthy for you to continue on
for years feeling an intense longing and
loss except for small periods of it I
did lose my father
and the loss was intense and the sadness
was intense and it did last a long time
but it did lessen and finally go and now
I'm more wistful about it and that was a
good relationship you know
it would have been really sick for me to
just continue to cry and miss him in
that way that certain way that makes a
hole in your heart that that is combined
with injustice the way it is when the
narcissist discards you or when you're
being mistreated it's a different it's a
different sadness and it's a very
unhealthy place to be so just try and
analyze your pain and be really honest
with yourself are you in pain because
you think you can some day put it back
together like if you let go of that pain
do you somehow know that that'll be it
you will heal you will heal your heart
will scar over in that place and they'll
never come back in you'll never let them
back in are you afraid of that a little
bit
late night musings on pain
enjoy your night peace
you
